pengu.database

Class ContactsDBCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • pengu.database.PenguAccessDBCommunicator
      • pengu.database.ContactsDBCommunicator

  • public class ContactsDBCommunicator
extends PenguAccessDBCommunicator
    This class provides the methods required for contact related database transactions.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • fetchUsers

        public java.sql.ResultSet fetchUsers()
        Fetches a list of user details: UserID, Username, DisplayName, ContactTypeID, NamingConvention (of the contact type), HexColourCode (of the contact type).
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet
        See Also:
        ResultSet

      • addUser

        public int addUser(java.lang.String username)
        Adds a user to the contacts list table. Only the user's Username is added and other fields are set to default.
        Parameters:
        username - The String representation of the Username
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • getUserIDByUsername

        public int getUserIDByUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Fetches the userID of a user from a specified username.
        Parameters:
        username - They user's username string.
        Returns:
        Returns an Integer representation of the userID, if the user does not exist -1 will be returned.

      • getContactDetails

        public java.sql.ResultSet getContactDetails(java.lang.String username)
        Fetches the specified user's contact details from the contact related tables.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "UserID", "Username", "DisplayName", "AdditionalInformation", "NamingConvention", and "HEXColorCode".

      • editContact

        public int editContact(int userID,
                       java.lang.String displayName,
                       int contactTypeID,
                       java.lang.String additiionalInformation)
        Edits the user's details in the contact list table.
        Parameters:
        userID - The user's ID
        displayName - The user's display name, a friendly name.
        contactTypeID - The contact type to which the user should remain/be added.
        additiionalInformation - Any additional information about the user.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • editContactFriendlyName

        public void editContactFriendlyName(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String friendlyName)
        Edits the user's friendly name in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The user's username.
        friendlyName - The new friendly name for the user.

      • editContactAdditionalInformation

        public void editContactAdditionalInformation(java.lang.String username,
                                             java.lang.String additionalInformation)
        Edits the user's additional information in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The user's username.
        additionalInformation - The new additional information for the user.

      • deleteContact

        public int deleteContact(int userID)
        Deletes the user from the contact list table.
        Parameters:
        userID - The user's ID.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • addContactType

        public int addContactType(java.lang.String namingConvention,
                          java.lang.String hexColourCode)
        Adds a contact type to the contact type table.
        Parameters:
        namingConvention - The friendly name or naming convention for the new contact group.
        hexColourCode - The colour code (HEX) of the contact group.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • getContactTypes

        public java.sql.ResultSet getContactTypes()
        Fetches a list of Contact Types from the database.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "ContactTypeID", "NamingConvention", and "HexColourCode".

      • setContactContactType

        public int setContactContactType(java.lang.String username,
                                 int contactTypeID)
        Edits the contact type of a contact.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the contact.
        contactTypeID - The contact type ID to set.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer count of number of affected rows.

      • deleteContactType

        public int deleteContactType(int contactTypeID)
        Deletes the specified contact group.
        Parameters:
        contactTypeID - The contact group's ID.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • getPublicKeys

        public java.sql.ResultSet getPublicKeys(int userID)
        Fetches a list of Public Keys for a specified user.
        Parameters:
        userID - The user's ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "PublicKeyString", "PublicKeyExpiryDate", and "PublicKeyRegistrationDate".
        See Also:
        ResultSet

      • addPublicKey

        public int addPublicKey(int userID,
                        java.lang.String publicKeyString,
                        java.util.Date regDate,
                        java.util.Date expDate)
        Adds a Public Key for a specified user.
        Parameters:
        userID - The user's ID.
        publicKeyString - The String (Base64) representation of the Public Key.
        regDate - The date when the Public Key was created.
        expDate - The date when the Public Key expires.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • addPrivateKey

        public int addPrivateKey(java.lang.String privateKeyString,
                         java.util.Date regDate,
                         java.util.Date expDate,
                         java.lang.String publicKeyHash)
        Adds a Private Key to the local Private Key table.
        Parameters:
        privateKeyString - The String (Base64) representation of the Private Key.
        regDate - The date when the Private Key was created.
        expDate - The date when the Private Key expires.
        publicKeyHash - The Public Key hash String.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer describing how many records where affected.

      • getPrivateKeys

        public java.sql.ResultSet getPrivateKeys()
        Fetches a list of Private Keys from the local Private Key table.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet containing columns: "PrivateKeyString", "PublicKeyString", "PrivateKeyExpiryDate", and "PrivateKeyRegistrationDate".
        See Also:
        ResultSet
